trans-unit.target: A note on flex usage: While flex is the fastest validation backend, unfortunately it is no longer maintained and there are issues with its dependencies. For one thing, it depends on a version of

trans-unit.source: After installing prance, a CLI is available for validating (and resolving external references in) specs:
trans-unit.target: После установки prance,CLI доступен для проверки (и разрешения внешних ссылок в)спецификаций:

trans-unit.source: Different validation backends support different features.
trans-unit.target: Различные бэкэнды проверки поддерживают различные функции.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might create a package
If you use the flex subpackage, therefore, you do so at your own risk.
trans-unit.target: Поэтому,если вы используете гибкий субпакет,вы делаете это на свой страх и риск.

trans-unit.source: It’s possible to instruct the parser to only resolve some kinds of references. This allows e.g. resolving references from external URLs, whilst keeping local references (i.e. to local files, or file internal) intact.
trans-unit.target: It’s possible to instruct the parser to only resolve some kinds of references. This allows e.g. resolving references from external URLs, whilst keeping local references (i.e. to local files, or file internal) intact.

trans-unit.source: Largely, that’s it. There is a whole slew of utility code that you may or may not find useful, too. Look at the full documentation for details.
trans-unit.target: Largely, that’s it. There is a whole slew of utility code that you may or may not find useful, too. Look at the full documentation for details.

trans-unit.source: Lastly, with the arrival of OpenAPI 3.0.0, it becomes useful for tooling to convert older specs to the new standard. Instead of re-inventing the wheel, prance just provides a CLI command for passing specs to the web API of swagger2openapi - a working internet connection is therefore required for this command:
trans-unit.target: Lastly, with the arrival of OpenAPI 3.0.0, it becomes useful for tooling to convert older specs to the new standard. Instead of re-inventing the wheel, prance just provides a CLI command for passing specs to the web API of swagger2openapi - a working internet connection is therefore required for this command:

trans-unit.source: Most likely you have spec file and want to parse it:
trans-unit.target: Скорее всего,у вас есть спецификация и вы хотите ее разобрать:

trans-unit.source: Mostly the latter involves handling non-URI references; OpenAPI is fine with providing relative file paths, whereas JSON references require URIs at this point in time.
trans-unit.target: В основном это касается работы со ссылками,не относящимися кURI;OpenAPI прекрасно подходит для предоставления относительных путей к файлам,в то время как JSON ссылки требуют URI на данный момент.

trans-unit.source: Multiple types can be specified by OR-ing constants together:
trans-unit.target: Несколько типов могут быть заданы константами OR-ing вместе:

trans-unit.source: No backend is included in the dependencies; they are detected at run-time. If you install them, they can be used:
trans-unit.target: Бэкэнд не включается в зависимости;они обнаруживаются во время выполнения.Если вы их установите,они могут быть использованы:

trans-unit.source: Note that this will install the code, but additional subpackages must be specified to unlock various pieces of functionality. At minimum, a parsing backend must be installed. For the CLI functionality, you need further dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Обратите внимание,что при этом будет установлен код,но для разблокировки различных функций необходимо указать дополнительные подпакеты.Как минимум,должен быть установлен бэкэнд разбора.Для функциональности CLI необходимы дополнительные зависимости.

trans-unit.source: On Windows, the code reacts correctly if you pass posix-like paths (
trans-unit.target: В Windows код корректно реагирует при прохождении posix-подобных путей (

trans-unit.source: Prance also includes a non-resolving parser that does not follow JSON references, in case you prefer that.
trans-unit.target: Prance также включает в себя нерешающий парсер,который не следует JSON ссылкам,в случае,если вы предпочитаете это.

trans-unit.source: Prance includes the ability to reference outside swagger definitions in outside Python packages. Such a package must already be importable (i.e. installed), and be accessible via the ResourceManager API (some more info here).
trans-unit.target: Prance includes the ability to reference outside swagger definitions in outside Python packages. Such a package must already be importable (i.e. installed), and be accessible via the ResourceManager API (some more info here).

trans-unit.source: Prance is available from PyPI, and can be installed via pip:
trans-unit.target: Prance доступен в PyPI,и может быть установлен через трубопровод:

trans-unit.source: Prance provides parsers for Swagger/OpenAPI 2.0 and 3.0 API specifications in Python. It uses openapi_spec_validator, swagger_spec_validator or flex to validate specifications, but additionally resolves JSON references in accordance with the OpenAPI spec.
trans-unit.target: Prance provides parsers for Swagger/OpenAPI 2.0 and 3.0 API specifications in Python. It uses openapi_spec_validator, swagger_spec_validator or flex to validate specifications, but additionally resolves JSON references in accordance with the OpenAPI spec.

trans-unit.source: Professional support is available through finkhaeuser consulting.
trans-unit.target: Professional support is available through finkhaeuser consulting.

trans-unit.source: See COMPATIBILITY.rst for a list of known issues.
trans-unit.target: See COMPATIBILITY.rst for a list of known issues.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, but less critically, Python 3.4 is no longer receiving a lot of love from CI vendors, so automated builds on that version are no longer supported.
trans-unit.target: Аналогично,но менее критично то,что Python 3.4 больше не получает большой любви от вендоров CI,поэтому автоматизированные сборки на этой версии больше не поддерживаются.

trans-unit.source: Slow; does not accept integer keys (see strict mode).
The recommended installation installs the CLI, uses ICU and installs one validation backend:
trans-unit.target: Рекомендуемая установка устанавливает CLI,использует ICU и устанавливает один бэкэнд проверки:

trans-unit.source: Until fairly recently, we also tested with PyPy. Unfortunately, Travis isn’t very good at supporting this. So in the absence of spare time, they’re disabled. Issue 50 tracks progress on that.
trans-unit.target: Until fairly recently, we also tested with PyPy. Unfortunately, Travis isn’t very good at supporting this. So in the absence of spare time, they’re disabled. Issue 50 tracks progress on that.

trans-unit.source: Validation is not the only feature of prance. One of the side effects of resolving is that from a spec with references, one can create a fully resolved output spec. In the past, this was done via options to the
trans-unit.target: Проверка не является единственной особенностью prance.Одним из побочных эффектов разрешения является то,что из спецификации со ссылками можно создать полностью разрешенную выходную спецификацию.Раньше это делалось через опции для

trans-unit.source: Version 0.16.2 is the last version supporting Python 2. It was released on Nov 12th, 2019. Python 2 reaches end of life at the end of 2019. If you wish for updates to the Python 2 supported packages, please contact the maintainer directly.
trans-unit.target: Версия 0.16.2 является последней версией,поддерживающей Python 2.Она была выпущена 12 ноября 2019 года.Python 2 достигает конца жизни в конце 2019 года.Если вы хотите обновить поддерживаемые пакеты Python 2,пожалуйста,свяжитесь напрямую с мэйнтейнером.
